Diagnosis . Adult (
Fig. 7
) with wingspan 8.0−9.5 mm.
Cochylidia moguntiana
can be easily distinguished from its congeners by the ventral margin of the valva concaved at base in the male genitalia (
Fig. 16
).
Cochylidia moguntiana
is similar to
C. richteriana
in the female genitalia (
Fig. 23
), but in
C. moguntiana
the corpus bursae is slightly shorter than the ductus bursae. In
C. richteriana
, the corpus bursae is about two times as long as the ductus bursae.

Distribution. China (Anhui, Beijing, Fujian, Gansu, Guizhou, Hebei, Heilongjiang, Henan, Hunan, Inner Mongolia , Liaoning, Ningxia, Shaanxi, Shandong, Shanxi, Sichuan, Tianjin ), Korea , Afghanistan , Iran , Russia , Europe.
